prompt:
Give me a description of someone who works as an archaeologist.
An archaeologist is a person who studies ancient human cultures and societies through their artifacts, architecture, and other physical remains. They often work at historical sites and museums, excavating ruins, uncovering artifacts, and interpreting the evidence left behind by past civilizations. Archaeologists are typically experts in one particular field, such as prehistory, classical antiquity, medieval studies, or even underwater archaeology.
